content.description: Squat start and move out of the cave on cool slopers and edges.  Ends on the giant jug hueco unless you are feeling ballsy...

climbs.name: Standing On The Corner Watching All The Girls Go By

content.description: A fun jug haul until you reach the lip, most folks do the V3 version that just reaches the lip and drops off.  Sit-start on jugs and move through a couple of good slopers and finger pockets to reach the lip.  For the full problem, grovel your way over the lip on slopers.
content.protection: Pad and a spotter to check you off the rock below.
content.location: In the same cave as Watch the Dog about ten feet to the right.

content.description: One of my many unfinished nemeses..There is a man-sized hueco at ground level about 7 or 10 feet right of Soot Patrol.  This climb starts in the low hole and moves over the bulge campusing between holds that are better than they look.  After matching on the jug protrusion, move left and try to find a way to stand up over the bulge.
content.protection: Pad with a nice flat landing.
content.location: A few feet right of Soot Patrol

content.description:
Go up via some very bad holds to a decent edge, and, if you're feeling brave, up the manky slab above to top out the boulder.

I have not sent, only tried this route a few times, so I don't know exactly how hard it is, but the holds you end up deadhanging off of definitely suck, so Banks' grade seems reasonable.

Anyway, this route has some of the weirdest movement I've ever experienced.

Fun to work on.
content.protection: One pad is sufficient if you plan on stepping off after the difficult portion. If you want to top out, I'd suggest a spot or two and a few more pads.
content.location: To the right of Mr Witty. Sit start on the left side of the cave, left hand on the large undercling hueco and right on the arete feature of the cave.
